channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MD
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MD

item.title: Report X-2023081900
item.description:
Report X-2023081900

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-25T03:13:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-21
  • City: SPARROWS POINT
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: this is a unprocessed hazmat. hazmat labeling was present on outer container but was not shipped as a hazmat.outer container was wet.upon inspection 1 bottle had a loose cap leaking out approx 40 oz of content. DescribePack: failure was due to loose cap causing internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: fold absorb was used to address spill.package was placed in hazmat tote and put under ventilation system.

item.title: Report I-2023090095
item.description:
Report I-2023090095

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-22T15:12:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-14
  • City: Baltimore
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS MINIBULK, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PVS Minibulk Driver was unloading hydrochloric acid into a tank when the driver noticed the product was leaking out of a 55-gallon drum that was being used as an overflow tank. A valve on the customers tank was left open and the product was flowing into the overflow drum which had a crack in the bottom of it. The driver then shut off his valves from the truck to stop the unloading process to allow customer to close the valve. The product was flowing out of the cracked drum onto a concrete pad for 5 minutes. The customer took responsibility for the release and replaced the cracked drum to ensure there would not be a release in the future if the overflow tank would be utilized. The product was used in the cleaning process of the concrete pad where it was spilled.

item.title: Report E-2023090512
item.description:
Report E-2023090512

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-20
  • City: BOWIE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was stopped at a red light at the intersection of Annapolis Road and Crane Highway near Bowie, Maryland when another vehicle struck the rear end of the tank trailer. Due to the extent of damage to the trailer, the gasoline needed to be transferred into another trailer. During the course of the transfer, approximately 1 gallon of gasoline was released. First Call Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: I found damage package in damage hazmat cage. I repacked it in a salvage drum and completed the required reports. DescribePack: The caps on several container came off. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The destroyed packaging and containers were placed in a tub and moved to the damage hazmat cage

item.title: Report X-2023081674
item.description:
Report X-2023081674

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-22
  • City: BELTSVILLE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A PACKAGE HANDLER WAS LOADING THE PACKAGE ONTO A PD VEHICLE WHEN THEY NOTICED THAT THERE WAS LEAKAGE OF THE MATERIAL ON THE OVERPACK. OPS MANAGER ARIF ZOULKARNI WAS NOTIFIED, PLACED THE PAKCAGE IN A LINED HAZ TOTE AND TRANSFERED IT TO THE DISGNATED AREA FOR DAMAGED HAZARDOUS MATERIALS. DescribePack: THE LOOSE CAP OF THE JERRICAN WAS DETERMINED TO BE THE MAIN CONTRIBUTING FACTOR TO THE RELEASE OF THE HAZARDOUDS MATERIAL. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED HAZ TOTE AND WAS REMOVED FROM THE VAN LINE.

item.title: Report E-2023070751
item.description:
Report E-2023070751

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-20T00:32:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-24
  • City: FORESTVILLE
  • State: MD
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling on the exit ramp from I 495 to Pennsylvania Avenue near Forestville, Maryland when the truck and trailer rolled over. This was a single vehicle accident. Approximately 75 gallons of gasoline was released from the trailer. First Call Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
